venue.name: Saint Anselm College - New Hampshire Institute of Politics

item.description:
Dr. Arthur Bradley, a distinguished NASA engineer, expert on emergency preparedness and author, joins the Institute to discuss his new book called Disaster Preparedness for Individuals and Families as part of the Bookmark Series.

In this brief presentation, Dr. Bradley discusses the importance of preparing and outlines a step-by-step process to creating an effective disaster preparedness plan.

Dr. Bradley believes that while most of the time the world functions normally, there is always the potential for natural disaster that is sometimes very dangerous. He explains that this danger comes from the uncertainty of a complex ecosystem among other factors.

Dr. Bradley’s books include the Handbook to Practical Disaster Preparedness for the Family, Disaster Preparedness for EMP Attacks and Solar Storms, and the Prepper’s Instruction Manual.
